body_html:
That looks more like a user error than a bug and we're using GitHub issues for bug reports only. You can post your question on our forums.

I printed train, before passing it to out = model(train) then got vectors with large numbers. Also, I printed x after x = self.fc1(x) then got nan. I doubt this's a bug.
body_text:
That looks more like a user error than a bug and we're using GitHub issues for bug reports only. You can post your question on our forums.

I printed train, before passing it to out = model(train) then got vectors with large numbers. Also, I printed x after x = self.fc1(x) then got nan. I doubt this's a bug.
body:
> That looks more like a user error than a bug and we're using GitHub issues for bug reports only. You can post your question on our forums.

I printed `train`, before passing it to `out = model(train)` then got vectors with large numbers. Also, I printed `x` after `x = self.fc1(x)` then got nan. I doubt this's a bug.
